Let’s think about statistics

title: Time-Series Analysis
text: Our data exists over time.

title: Time-Series Analysis
text: So, what is our population?

title: Time-Series Analysis
section: Is it the past to the present?
text:
Is it the past to the present?



Maybe. Maybe not.

title: Time-Series Analysis
section: Maybe it’s the past, present, and future?
text: Maybe it’s the past, present, and future?

title: Time-Series Analysis
text:
Or…just the future?



But…we can’t sample from the future!




So…what is our sample?

title: Time-Series Analysis
section: Our sample is a sample timeframe.
text: Our sample is a sample timeframe.

title: Time-Series Analysis
text: This is imperfect.

title: Time-Series Analysis
section: Because our reality is constant change.

title: Time-Series Analysis
text:
A stationary time series is one whose statistical properties do not depend on the time at which the series is observed. 1


Forecasting Principles and Practice, 3rd Edition, Rob J. Hyndman and George Athansopoulos

text:
